      37             : #define SET_NODE(target, src) do { \
      38             :                 target ## _type = (src)->op_type; \
      39             :                 if ((src)->op_type == IS_CONST) { \
      40             :                         target.constant = zend_add_literal(&(src)->u.constant); \
      41             :                 } else { \
      42             :                         target = (src)->u.op; \
      43             :                 } \
      44             :         } while (0)

    1881             : /* {{{ zend_dirname

    1883       23570 : ZEND_API size_t zend_dirname(char *path, size_t len)
    1884             : {
    1885       23570 :         char *end = path + len - 1;
    1886       23570 :         unsigned int len_adjust = 0;
    1887             : 
    1888             : #ifdef ZEND_WIN32
    1889             :         /* Note that on Win32 CWD is per drive (heritage from CP/M).
    1890             :          * This means dirname("c:foo") maps to "c:." or "c:" - which means CWD on C: drive.
    1891             :          */
    1892             :         if ((2 <= len) && isalpha((int)((unsigned char *)path)[0]) && (':' == path[1])) {
    1893             :                 /* Skip over the drive spec (if any) so as not to change */
    1894             :                 path += 2;
    1895             :                 len_adjust += 2;
    1896             :                 if (2 == len) {
    1897             :                         /* Return "c:" on Win32 for dirname("c:").
    1898             :                          * It would be more consistent to return "c:."
    1899             :                          * but that would require making the string *longer*.
    1900             :                          */
    1901             :                         return len;
    1902             :                 }
    1903             :         }
    1904             : #endif
    1905             : 
    1906       23570 :         if (len == 0) {
    1907             :                 /* Illegal use of this function */
    1908          51 :                 return 0;
    1909             :         }
    1910             : 
    1911             :         /* Strip trailing slashes */
    1912       23798 :         while (end >= path && IS_SLASH_P(end)) {
    1913         279 :                 end--;
    1914             :         }
    1915       23519 :         if (end < path) {
    1916             :                 /* The path only contained slashes */
    1917          39 :                 path[0] = DEFAULT_SLASH;
    1918          39 :                 path[1] = '\0';
    1919          39 :                 return 1 + len_adjust;
    1920             :         }
    1921             : 
    1922             :         /* Strip filename */
    1923      494176 :         while (end >= path && !IS_SLASH_P(end)) {
    1924      470696 :                 end--;
    1925             :         }
    1926       23480 :         if (end < path) {
    1927             :                 /* No slash found, therefore return '.' */
    1928         435 :                 path[0] = '.';
    1929         435 :                 path[1] = '\0';
    1930         435 :                 return 1 + len_adjust;
    1931             :         }
    1932             : 
    1933             :         /* Strip slashes which came before the file name */
    1934       46135 :         while (end >= path && IS_SLASH_P(end)) {
    1935       23090 :                 end--;
    1936             :         }
    1937       23045 :         if (end < path) {
    1938          78 :                 path[0] = DEFAULT_SLASH;
    1939          78 :                 path[1] = '\0';

    1941             :         }

    2194     5938860 : static bool zend_ast_kind_is_short_circuited(zend_ast_kind ast_kind)

    2210      781367 : static bool zend_ast_is_short_circuited(const zend_ast *ast)
    2211             : {
    2212      781367 :         switch (ast->kind) {
    2213       39504 :                 case ZEND_AST_DIM:
    2214             :                 case ZEND_AST_PROP:

    2218       39504 :                         return zend_ast_is_short_circuited(ast->child[0]);

    2221         129 :                         return 1;
    2222      741734 :                 default:
    2223      741734 :                         return 0;
    2224             :         }
    2225             : }
    2226             : 
    2227             : /* Mark nodes that are an inner part of a short-circuiting chain.
    2228             :  * We should not perform a "commit" on them, as it will be performed by the outer-most node.
    2229             :  * We do this to avoid passing down an argument in various compile functions. */
    2230             : 
    2231             : #define ZEND_SHORT_CIRCUITING_INNER 0x8000
    2232             : 
    2233      149757 : static void zend_short_circuiting_mark_inner(zend_ast *ast) {
    2234      149757 :         if (zend_ast_kind_is_short_circuited(ast->kind)) {
    2235       13015 :                 ast->attr |= ZEND_SHORT_CIRCUITING_INNER;
    2236             :         }
    2237      149757 : }
    2238             : 
    2239     5876560 : static uint32_t zend_short_circuiting_checkpoint(void)
    2240             : {
    2241     5876560 :         return zend_stack_count(&CG(short_circuiting_opnums));
    2242             : }
    2243             : 
    2244     5789100 : static void zend_short_circuiting_commit(uint32_t checkpoint, znode *result, zend_ast *ast)
    2245             : {
    2246     5789100 :         bool is_short_circuited = zend_ast_kind_is_short_circuited(ast->kind)
    2247     5789100 :                 || ast->kind == ZEND_AST_ISSET || ast->kind == ZEND_AST_EMPTY;
    2248     5789100 :         if (!is_short_circuited) {
    2249     5539330 :                 ZEND_ASSERT(zend_stack_count(&CG(short_circuiting_opnums)) == checkpoint
    2250             :                         && "Short circuiting stack should be empty");
    2251     5539330 :                 return;
    2252             :         }
    2253             : 
    2254      249775 :         if (ast->attr & ZEND_SHORT_CIRCUITING_INNER) {
    2255             :                 /* Outer-most node will commit. */
    2256        7156 :                 return;
    2257             :         }
    2258             : 
    2259      243045 :         while (zend_stack_count(&CG(short_circuiting_opnums)) != checkpoint) {
    2260         426 :                 uint32_t opnum = *(uint32_t *) zend_stack_top(&CG(short_circuiting_opnums));

    2332        9318 : static void zend_emit_return_type_check(
    2333             :                 znode *expr, zend_arg_info *return_info, bool implicit) /* {{{ */
    2334             : {
    2335        9318 :         zend_type type = return_info->type;
    2336        9318 :         if (ZEND_TYPE_IS_SET(type)) {
    2337             :                 zend_op *opline;
    2338             : 
    2339             :                 /* `return ...;` is illegal in a void function (but `return;` isn't) */
    2340        9318 :                 if (ZEND_TYPE_CONTAINS_CODE(type, IS_VOID)) {
    2341        1241 :                         if (expr) {
    2342          12 :                                 if (expr->op_type == IS_CONST && Z_TYPE(expr->u.constant) == IS_NULL) {
    2343           3 :                                         zend_error_noreturn(E_COMPILE_ERROR,
    2344             :                                                 "A void function must not return a value "
    2345             :                                                 "(did you mean \"return;\" instead of \"return null;\"?)");
    2346             :                                 } else {
    2347           3 :                                         zend_error_noreturn(E_COMPILE_ERROR, "A void function must not return a value");
    2348             :                                 }
    2349             :                         }
    2350             :                         /* we don't need run-time check */
    2351        3067 :                         return;
    2352             :                 }
    2353             : 
    2354             :                 /* `return` is illegal in a never-returning function */
    2355        8077 :                 if (ZEND_TYPE_CONTAINS_CODE(type, IS_NEVER)) {
    2356             :                         /* Implicit case handled separately using VERIFY_NEVER_TYPE opcode. */
    2357          12 :                         ZEND_ASSERT(!implicit);
    2358          12 :                         zend_error_noreturn(E_COMPILE_ERROR, "A never-returning function must not return");
    2359             :                         return;
    2360             :                 }
    2361             : 
    2362        8065 :                 if (!expr && !implicit) {

    2364           3 :                                 zend_error_noreturn(E_COMPILE_ERROR,

    2366             :                                         "(did you mean \"return null;\" instead of \"return;\"?)");
    2367             :                         } else {
    2368           3 :                                 zend_error_noreturn(E_COMPILE_ERROR,

    2371             :                 }

    3091        8992 : static void zend_compile_expr_with_potential_assign_to_self(

    3202        1887 : static void zend_compile_assign_ref(znode *result, zend_ast *ast) /* {{{ */

    3204        1887 :         zend_ast *target_ast = ast->child[0];

    3348         420 : static uint32_t zend_get_arg_num(zend_function *fn, zend_string *arg_name) {
    3349             :         // TODO: Caching?
    3350         420 :         if (fn->type == ZEND_USER_FUNCTION) {
    3351        1053 :                 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < fn->common.num_args; i++) {
    3352        1017 :                         zend_arg_info *arg_info = &fn->op_array.arg_info[i];
    3353        2034 :                         if (zend_string_equals(arg_info->name, arg_name)) {
    3354         210 :                                 return i + 1;
    3355             :                         }
    3356             :                 }
    3357             :         } else {
    3358         435 :                 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < fn->common.num_args; i++) {
    3359         396 :                         zend_internal_arg_info *arg_info = &fn->internal_function.arg_info[i];

    3361         396 :                         if (len == ZSTR_LEN(arg_name) && !memcmp(arg_info->name, ZSTR_VAL(arg_name), len)) {
    3362         135 :                                 return i + 1;
    3363             :                         }
    3364             :                 }
    3365             :         }
    3366             : 
    3367             :         /* Either an invalid argument name, or collected into a variadic argument. */
    3368          75 :         return (uint32_t) -1;
    3369             : }

    3371      384940 : static uint32_t zend_compile_args(
    3372             :                 zend_ast *ast, zend_function *fbc, bool *may_have_extra_named_args) /* {{{ */

    3379             :         /* Whether named arguments are used syntactically, to enforce language level limitations.
    3380             :          * May not actually use named argument passing. */

    3851             : /* We can only calculate the stack size for functions that have been fully compiled, otherwise

    5164        4986 : static void zend_compile_for(zend_ast *ast) /* {{{ */

    5174        4986 :         zend_compile_expr_list(&result, init_ast);
    5175        4986 :         zend_do_free(&result);
    5176             : 
    5177        4986 :         opnum_jmp = zend_emit_jump(0);
    5178             : 
    5179        4986 :         zend_begin_loop(ZEND_NOP, NULL, 0);
    5180             : 
    5181        4986 :         opnum_start = get_next_op_number();
    5182        4986 :         zend_compile_stmt(stmt_ast);
    5183             :

    5190        4983 :         zend_do_extended_stmt();

    5198       11004 : static void zend_compile_foreach(zend_ast *ast) /* {{{ */

    5333        1127 : static zend_uchar determine_switch_jumptable_type(zend_ast_list *cases) {

    5374        1081 : static bool should_use_jumptable(zend_ast_list *cases, zend_uchar jumptable_type) {
    5375        1081 :         if (CG(compiler_options) & ZEND_COMPILE_NO_JUMPTABLES) {
    5376           0 :                 return 0;
    5377             :         }
    5378             : 
    5379             :         /* Thresholds are chosen based on when the average switch time for equidistributed
    5380             :          * input becomes smaller when using the jumptable optimization. */
    5381        1081 :         if (jumptable_type == IS_LONG) {
    5382         219 :                 return cases->children >= 5;
    5383             :         } else {
    5384         862 :                 ZEND_ASSERT(jumptable_type == IS_STRING);
    5385         862 :                 return cases->children >= 2;
    5386             :         }
    5387             : }

    5389        1127 : static void zend_compile_switch(zend_ast *ast) /* {{{ */
    5390             : {
    5391        1127 :         zend_ast *expr_ast = ast->child[0];

    5523         180 : static uint32_t count_match_conds(zend_ast_list *arms)

    5540         180 : static bool can_match_use_jumptable(zend_ast_list *arms) {

    5567         180 : static void zend_compile_match(znode *result, zend_ast *ast)
    5568             : {
    5569         180 :         zend_ast *expr_ast = ast->child[0];
    5570         180 :         zend_ast_list *arms = zend_ast_get_list(ast->child[1]);
    5571         180 :         bool has_default_arm = 0;
    5572         180 :         uint32_t opnum_match = (uint32_t)-1;
    5573             : 
    5574             :         znode expr_node;
    5575         180 :         zend_compile_expr(&expr_node, expr_ast);
    5576             : 
    5577             :         znode case_node;
    5578         180 :         case_node.op_type = IS_TMP_VAR;
    5579         180 :         case_node.u.op.var = get_temporary_variable();
    5580             : 
    5581         180 :         uint32_t num_conds = count_match_conds(arms);
    5582         180 :         zend_uchar can_use_jumptable = can_match_use_jumptable(arms);
    5583         180 :         bool uses_jumptable = can_use_jumptable && num_conds >= 2;
    5584         180 :         HashTable *jumptable = NULL;
    5585         180 :         uint32_t *jmpnz_opnums = NULL;
    5586             : 
    5587         699 :         for (uint32_t i = 0; i < arms->children; ++i) {
    5588         522 :                 zend_ast *arm_ast = arms->child[i];
    5589             : 
    5590         522 :                 if (!arm_ast->child[0]) {
    5591          81 :                         if (has_default_arm) {
    5592           3 :                                 CG(zend_lineno) = arm_ast->lineno;
    5593           3 :                                 zend_error_noreturn(E_COMPILE_ERROR,
    5594             :                                         "Match expressions may only contain one default arm");
    5595             :                         }
    5596          78 :                         has_default_arm = 1;
    5597             :                 }
    5598             :         }
    5599             : 
    5600         177 :         if (uses_jumptable) {

    6792             :

    7199        9443 : static void zend_compile_prop_decl(zend_ast *ast, zend_ast *type_ast, uint32_t flags, zend_ast *attr_ast) /* {{{ */

    7898         528 : static void zend_compile_use(zend_ast *ast) /* {{{ */
    7899             : {
    7900         528 :         zend_ast_list *list = zend_ast_get_list(ast);
    7901             :         uint32_t i;
    7902         528 :         zend_string *current_ns = FC(current_namespace);
    7903         528 :         uint32_t type = ast->attr;
    7904         528 :         HashTable *current_import = zend_get_import_ht(type);
    7905         528 :         bool case_sensitive = type == ZEND_SYMBOL_CONST;
    7906             : 
    7907        1038 :         for (i = 0; i < list->children; ++i) {
    7908         552 :                 zend_ast *use_ast = list->child[i];
    7909         552 :                 zend_ast *old_name_ast = use_ast->child[0];
    7910         552 :                 zend_ast *new_name_ast = use_ast->child[1];

    7912             :                 zend_string *new_name, *lookup_name;
    7913             : 
    7914         552 :                 if (new_name_ast) {
    7915         402 :                         new_name = zend_string_copy(zend_ast_get_str(new_name_ast));
    7916             :                 } else {

    7922             :                         } else {
    7923          54 :                                 new_name = zend_string_copy(old_name);

    7927          12 :                                                 "has no effect", ZSTR_VAL(new_name));
    7928             :                                 }
    7929             :                         }
    7930             :                 }
    7931             :

    7936             :                 }

    7941             :                 }

    7971          54 : static void zend_compile_group_use(zend_ast *ast) /* {{{ */
    7972             : {
    7973             :         uint32_t i;
    7974          54 :         zend_string *ns = zend_ast_get_str(ast->child[0]);
    7975          54 :         zend_ast_list *list = zend_ast_get_list(ast->child[1]);
    7976             : 
    7977         204 :         for (i = 0; i < list->children; i++) {
    7978         150 :                 zend_ast *inline_use, *use = list->child[i];
    7979         150 :                 zval *name_zval = zend_ast_get_zval(use->child[0]);
    7980         150 :                 zend_string *name = Z_STR_P(name_zval);
    7981         150 :                 zend_string *compound_ns = zend_concat_names(ZSTR_VAL(ns), ZSTR_LEN(ns), ZSTR_VAL(name), ZSTR_LEN(name));
    7982             :                 zend_string_release_ex(name, 0);
    7983         300 :                 ZVAL_STR(name_zval, compound_ns);
    7984         150 :                 inline_use = zend_ast_create_list(1, ZEND_AST_USE, use);

    8427      255763 :                 Z_TRY_ADDREF_P(value);
    8428             : 
    8429      255763 :                 key_ast = elem_ast->child[1];

    8433      123783 :                                 case IS_LONG:

    8435      123783 :                                         break;

    8437       25374 :                                         zend_symtable_update(Z_ARRVAL_P(result), Z_STR_P(key), value);
    8438       25374 :                                         break;

    8452         207 :                                         break;

    8474      558932 : static void zend_compile_binary_op(znode *result, zend_ast *ast) /* {{{ */
    8475             : {
    8476      558932 :         zend_ast *left_ast = ast->child[0];
    8477      558932 :         zend_ast *right_ast = ast->child[1];
    8478      558932 :         uint32_t opcode = ast->attr;
    8479             :

    8481             :

    8483      558932 :         zend_compile_expr(&right_node, right_ast);
    8484             : 
    8485      558932 :         if (left_node.op_type == IS_CONST && right_node.op_type == IS_CONST) {
    8486      274740 :                 if (zend_try_ct_eval_binary_op(&result->u.constant, opcode,
    8487             :                                 &left_node.u.constant, &right_node.u.constant)

    8491      229947 :                         zval_ptr_dtor(&right_node.u.constant);
    8492      233230 :                         return;
    8493             :                 }
    8494             :         }

    8497      328985 :                 if (opcode == ZEND_IS_EQUAL || opcode == ZEND_IS_NOT_EQUAL) {

    8789        2733 : static void zend_compile_conditional(znode *result, zend_ast *ast) /* {{{ */
    8790             : {
    8791        2733 :         zend_ast *cond_ast = ast->child[0];
    8792        2733 :         zend_ast *true_ast = ast->child[1];
    8793        2733 :         zend_ast *false_ast = ast->child[2];
    8794             : 
    8795             :         znode cond_node, true_node, false_node;
    8796             :         zend_op *opline_qm_assign2;
    8797             :         uint32_t opnum_jmpz, opnum_jmp;
    8798             : 
    8799        2733 :         if (cond_ast->kind == ZEND_AST_CONDITIONAL
    8800          24 :                         && cond_ast->attr != ZEND_PARENTHESIZED_CONDITIONAL) {
    8801          12 :                 if (cond_ast->child[1]) {
    8802           6 :                         if (true_ast) {
    8803           3 :                                 zend_error(E_COMPILE_ERROR,
    8804             :                                         "Unparenthesized `a ? b : c ? d : e` is not supported. "
    8805             :                                         "Use either `(a ? b : c) ? d : e` or `a ? b : (c ? d : e)`");
    8806             :                         } else {
    8807           3 :                                 zend_error(E_COMPILE_ERROR,
    8808             :                                         "Unparenthesized `a ? b : c ?: d` is not supported. "
    8809             :                                         "Use either `(a ? b : c) ?: d` or `a ? b : (c ?: d)`");
    8810             :                         }
    8811             :                 } else {
    8812           6 :                         if (true_ast) {
    8813           3 :                                 zend_error(E_COMPILE_ERROR,
    8814             :                                         "Unparenthesized `a ?: b ? c : d` is not supported. "
    8815             :                                         "Use either `(a ?: b) ? c : d` or `a ?: (b ? c : d)`");
    8816             :                         } else {
    8817             :                                 /* This case is harmless:  (a ?: b) ?: c always produces the same result
    8818             :                                  * as a ?: (b ?: c). */
    8819             :                         }
    8820             :                 }
    8821             :         }
    8822             : 
    8823        2724 :         if (!true_ast) {
    8824         504 :                 zend_compile_shorthand_conditional(result, ast);
    8825         504 :                 return;

    8892             :          * to avoid double-evaluation when we compile again with BP_VAR_W. */

    9235       87789 : static void zend_compile_array(znode *result, zend_ast *ast) /* {{{ */
